title: Connection issues = Unfair Punishment

replies.body:
You have to remember that even if you are not leaving intentionally you're still negatively affecting 9 other people's game. I know it's frustrating, especially when it's something beyond your control, but if you're getting leaver busted then it must be happening pretty consistently. 

At the end of the day this is an online game, and while Riot does as much as they can to protect their players from issues like yours, in this case it's as beyond their control as it is yours, and they still have an obligation to protect those 9 other players from your issue, something that *is* within their power.

It sucks, but your choices here are to play with leaver buster penalties and simply find something else to do or play while you wait for the queue timer, or to only play when you know things are mostly stable. Either way you have to accept that your issue impacts other people's games, and that puts you at a disadvantage.
I understand what you are saying but when I play with friends who are more than aware of the issues and don't mind. I'm still being punished.

>I understand what you are saying but


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jIvYWUVB1Ig


get your internet sorted.

How do suppose I do that? Considering everyone in australia on the nbn is having the same or similar issues and its an international problem.. I'll just let em know to hurry up with the submarines yeah? So that I can get back to normal... At least reply with something useful other than a smart arse and idiot response. 

{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}

>How do suppose I do that? Considering everyone in australia on the nbn is having the same or similar issues and its an international problem

the sea cable has nothing to do with connections within Australia. 

also everyone i know who is playing on NBN has zero issues. hell even people who live out in the sticks with ADSL1 are doing fine.

Your home network is the blame. look into it.

you just don't like the fact you in the wrong. if you have bad internet accept it, and improve it. or dont play games.

You are still affecting the enemy team as well. Sure there are less people who mind a dc on the enemy team but it's not the experience Riot wants for it's players. You could perhaps try to organise customs instead, but ultimately it is what it is.
